perturbation.original_text: y) “Master Batch Record” means the complete detailed Manufacturing and control instructions and specifications for the Manufacturing Process for the Product, as defined by the applicable validation protocol and cGMP Requirements, as may be amended from time to time; in accordance with cGMP Requirements, or by mutual agreement of both Customer and Supplier;
perturbation.changed_text: y) “Master Batch Record” means a record of manufacturing activities.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the definition of 'Master Batch Record' to be a record of manufacturing activities, and removing the phrase 'the complete detailed Manufacturing and control instructions and specifications for the Manufacturing Process for the Product, as defined by the applicable validation protocol and cGMP Requirements,' the rest of the agreement now has contradictions. As the term is used elsewhere, but the actual details of what the Master Batch Record entails has been omitted.

perturbation.original_text: bb) “Product Specifications” means the specifications for the Product set forth in the Quality Agreement, as such may be amended from time to time in accordance with its terms;
perturbation.changed_text: bb) “Product Specifications” means a general description of the product.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the definition of 'Product Specifications' to 'means a general description of the product' but other areas refer to the same term being the 'specifications for the Product set forth in the Quality Agreement, as such may be amended from time to time in accordance with its terms;' there's an in-text contradiction. Now there's no clear objective criteria for the product.

perturbation.original_text: cc) “Quality Agreement” shall mean that certain Quality Agreement Relating to Contract Manufacturing Services by and between Customer and Supplier, dated [* * *];
perturbation.changed_text: cc) “Quality Agreement” shall mean an agreement about the quality of product.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the definition of 'Quality Agreement' to 'shall mean an agreement about the quality of product', that differs from being 'that certain Quality Agreement Relating to Contract Manufacturing Services by and between Customer and Supplier, dated [* * *];' as the original definition was. This creates an ambiguity because it's not clear what its implications are. Other sections use the original Quality Agreement definition and now a new, contradictory definition is created.
